Detailed Description

*

Implementation of the IPDR logging service.

Function Documentation

IPDR_Status Log_CheckLogLevel (  Log *  L,
IPDR_ModuleID  ModuleID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Lvl
) 
 

The function checks whether a specific module within the client (transmitter) outputs log messages at the given level.

Parameters:
L log
ModuleID module identifier (either IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID or #IPDR_HOST_MODULE_ID)
Lvl the level to test against
Returns:
1 if the module is outputing log messages at the requested level, 0 otherwise

Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_IPAddress  Addr,
unsigned short  Port,
unsigned int  Facility,
const char *  MachineName
) 
 

Set the Logger IP Address.

Parameters:
L log
Addr The logger IP address
Port The logger output port number.
Facility The "facility", as defined for SYSLOG.
MachineName The client's (trasnmitter's) identification, as defined for SYSLOG.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_Status Log_SetModuleDebugLevel (  Log *  L,
const char *  Name,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level
) 
 

Set the current debug level of a specific module (only messages within lower or equal debug level will be outputted from the module)

Parameters:
L logger
Name module name
Level module debug level
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_Status Log_VOutputStr (  Log *  L,
IPDR_ModuleID  ModuleID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level,
const char *  Func,
const char *  Str,
va_list  Args
) 
 

The function outputs a log message to the IPDR client (transmitter) log.

Parameters:
L logger
ModuleID module identifier (either IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID or IPDR_HOST_MODULE_ID)
Level message debug level
Func function originating the message
Str message (can be a printf style format string)
Args additional arguments in case of a formatted msg
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
